thread.title: Canon Solutions America Hosts Customer Appreciation Event
thread.title_full: Canon Solutions America Hosts Customer Appreciation Event

title: Canon Solutions America Hosts Customer Appreciation Event
text:
Canon Solutions America Hosts Customer Appreciation Event Captain Christie Rampone of the U.S. Women's National Soccer Team Featured as Special Guest September 14, 2015 15:33 ET | Source: Canon Solutions America 
MELVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 14, 2015 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Canon Solutions America, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Canon U.S.A., Inc., today announced that it hosted a Customer Appreciation Event during Canon EXPO New York 2015, held September 9-11, to thank and celebrate both new and existing valued customers. The distinguished event, which took place at the Gansevoort Park Avenue Penthouse, featured a keynote address from two-time World Cup winner and three-time gold medalist, Christie Rampone. Canon EXPO, the once-every-five-year event which will be held later this year in Paris and Tokyo as well, brings together Canon customers from around the world and exemplifies Canon's commitment to expanding the future of technology. As a bookend to the monumental New York gathering for some of the esteemed guests, Canon Solutions America, in conjunction with Canon EXPO, hosted over 200 customers to thank them for their trust in the company and valued partnerships. What followed was a truly special moment for all guests. Coming off a stunning year that included winning the Women's World Cup, Captain Christie Rampone of the U.S. Women's National Team spoke to the engaged audience on what it means to be a champion, earning success, and how to provide leadership day in and day out. Rampone, who at 40 became the oldest woman to ever play in a FIFA Women's World Cup, touched on the intangibles that have made her a two-time World Cup Champion and three-time Olympic gold medalist. "It was great to share my experiences with such an engaged and excited audience," said Rampone. "Talking with Canon Solutions America's executives and employees, along with their great customers, was a joy. I'm glad to have been a part of such a big night for the company." As the lights dimmed on a spirited night for Canon Solutions America, a feeling of appreciation emanated throughout the Gansevoort as customers bid adieu to their hosts. Coming together to celebrate and showcase Canon and its customers was only made possible through the commitment of customers and partners who continue to work with the organization. Canon Solutions America's Customer Appreciation Event was an extension of that theme, and proved once more that the company is always committed to acknowledging what is so much more than just business. "Without our great customers, events like this would not be possible," said Toyo Kuwamura, president and CEO, Canon Solutions America. "It was an exciting and memorable evening that was made possible by our customers, partners, and leading industry analysts. On behalf of Canon Solutions America, we thank them all for their continued support." About Christie Rampone 
Christie Rampone is the captain of the U.S. Women's National Soccer Team and the first four-time Olympian in the history of the squad and the only member of the team to win two FIFA Women's World Cups (1999, 2015). A five-time FIFA Women's World Cup, Rampone is recognized as the best defender in the world of women's soccer. With more than a decade and a half of experience under her belt, she has defined herself as the leader of the United States Women's National Team, which remains ranked No. 1 in the world. Christie is the ninth player in the Women's National Soccer Team's history to be named the team captain. Her leadership has paid dividends as she guided her team to three Olympic Gold Medals (2004, 2008, 2012). In addition, Christie has earned 309 caps - making her 2nd all time on the Women's National Soccer Team in international appearances. A New Jersey native, Christie, her husband Chris and their daughters live in Manasquan, NJ. Please follow Christie on Facebook and Twitter @ChristieRampone and on Instragram @ChristieRampone3. About Canon Solutions America, Inc. 
Canon Solutions America provides industry leading enterprise, production, and large format printing solutions, supported by exceptional professional service offerings. With the technology offerings of the Canon and Océ brands, Canon Solutions America helps companies of all sizes improve sustainability, increase efficiency, and control costs through high volume, continuous feed, digital and traditional printing, and document management solutions. A wholly owned subsidiary of Canon U.S.A., Inc., Canon Solutions America is headquartered in Melville, N.Y. and has sales and service locations across the U.S. For more information on Canon Solutions America, please visit csa.canon.com . 
Canon is a registered trademark of Canon Inc. in the United States and elsewhere. Océ is a registered trademark of Océ-Technologies B.V. in the United States and elsewhere.
